pr_title: [CDAP-17128] Add metrics for success/failure of Dataproc API calls

timeline.message: [CDAP-17128] Add metrics for success/failure of Dataproc API calls
[CDAP-17128] Add metrics for success/failure of Dataproc API calls

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't require constructing the full tag from the provisioner. Otherwise all provisioner implementation has to do this.
timeline.author: chtyim

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't expose the raw MetricsContext. Whatever emitted from the provisioner should already have the current metrics context setup. Also, since MetricsContext is in cdap-watchdog-api, which is not a dependency of cdap-runtime-spi, you should either have the emit metric method defined in the ProvisionerContext, or have a different metrics context defined in the cdap-runtime-spi module to better suit the provisioner SPI need.
timeline.author: chtyim
chtyim

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't use the Constants class from cdap-common.
timeline.author: chtyim

replies.bodyText: Also, only region and statusCode should be coming from the provisioner. The rest of the context should be populated by the system already
replies.author: chtyim

timeline.bodyText: Why add here? Custome metrics context (e.g. the one emitted by program or extension) shouldn't need to be defined here. The one who query simply provide "sc", "reg" as the context.
timeline.author: chtyim

timeline.bodyText: This segment of code has repeated many times. Better to refactor it out to the DataprocUtils method.
timeline.author: chtyim
chtyim
chtyim

timeline.bodyText: No need to have these comment. If you want to define these as constants, define a DataprocConstants class in the dataproc module.
timeline.author: chtyim

timeline.bodyText: Annotate the Exception e with @Nullable since null is allowed
timeline.author: chtyim

replies.author: chtyim

timeline.bodyText: I would suggest swap the e and metricName. Generally we extend more arguments
timeline.author: chtyim
